content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs the system, I have received an update that the command to write to a file in the language_learning.py file returned an error saying the file has already been updated. The command was executed twice. Additionally, I received two commands from you to write the code to the file and then execute it.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "pip install duolingo"}}}'}, {'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:\nb\'Requirement already satisfied: duolingo in /usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages (0.1.1)\\nRequirement already satisfied: oauth2>=1.5.211 in /usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages (from duolingo) (1.9.0.post1)\\nRequirement already satisfied: httplib2>=0.7.2 in /usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages (from duolingo) (0.22.0)\\nRequirement already satisfied: pyparsing!=3.0.0,!=3.0.1,!=3.0.2,!=3.0.3,<4,>=2.4.2 in /usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages (from httplib2>=0.7.2->duolingo) (3.0.9)\\n\'\nSTDERR:\nb"WARNING: Running pip as the \'root\' user can result in broken permissions and conflicting behaviour with the system package manager. It is recommended to use a virtual environment instead: https://pip.pypa.io/warnings/venv\\n\\n[notice] A new release of pip is available: 23.0.1 -> 23.1.2\\n[notice] To update, run: pip install --upgrade pip\\n"'}]
